heisig_chinese_memo: A large man with a small dog (pooch) sitting on his shoulder.
heisig_story: We know that the character for large takes on the meaning of the St. Bernard dog when used as a primitive. In this frame we finally see why. The drop added as a fourth and final stroke means that we have to do with a normal-sized dog, which compared to the St. Bernard is no more than a drop in the kennel.
koohiiStory2: If we remember large (#107) as a man with his arms outstretched, the drop represents manÂ´s best friend - a dog.
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: The dog radical and dog kanji are exactly the same!
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Soon there will be very few kanji/radical-same combos ... so enjoy it while you can.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: You see an emu running towards you from off in the distance (strange to see an emu in these parts...). As it gets closer, you realize that it's not an emu at all, it's something that sounds the same, or similar... an inu!
WaniKani_Reading_Info: There's a good chance you know the word for dog in Japanese already too. If so, you're ahead of the game. If not, do your best to learn the reading before moving on.

humanum_full_description_en:
Elaboration: The character " dog " in the Jiajin inscription is like the profile of a dog. In the Shang dynasty clan inscriptions, the character "ç‹—" was written horizontally. Later, due to the need for the characters to be arranged in a straight line, the character "ç‹—" changed its direction and turned into a vacant foot. " Dog " is characterized by a thin abdomen and a curled tail, which is different from the " hog " with a fat belly and a drooping tail (Wang Guowei), see " hog ". "Shuowen": "Dog, the dog is also a dog. Pictogram. Confucius said: "The word for a dog is like a picture dog." All dogs belong to dogs." Xu Hao Jian: "Dogs are ordinary dogs." The generic name of the hound, the smaller one is the dog. The dog is also the generic name if you say anything. Suspended, it means the hound, but the hound has one toe on its feet that doesnâ€™t touch the ground.â€ means â€œ dog â€, â€œ dog â€ Generally speaking, there is no difference. When distinguished, " dog " is a big dog and hunting dog, and " dog " is a puppy.

The oracle bone inscription is used as the original meaning, referring to dogs. "Compilation" 738 is: "Today (ç°) three sheep, two pigs, and three dogs." Refers to today's burning sacrifice with three sheep, two pigs, and three dogs. " Dog " is also used as the name of Fang Guohou, "Collection" 22471: "Dog Fang" refers to Fang Guo of dogs, located in Xingping South, southwest of Xianyang, Shaanxi. In addition, Oracle has the term "multi-dog", which is the official name of the hunting official. "Compilation" 10976 is: "Hu (hu) Duo Dog Net (Net) Lu Yu Nong (Nong)." Refers to ordering Duo Dog in the place of farming. Nets catch deer.

Bronze inscriptions are used as the original meaning of dogs, and Fangding: "The king commander is in charge of the dog." Also used as the clan name.
humanum_short_description_en: The inscriptions of " dog " are all dog-shaped. The original meaning is dog. The word dog was later written as "çŠ­" when used as a radical to other characters.

Dog: Hound. police dog. Hard work of dogs and horses. Houndstooth. Inuzi (Qianci, called his own son to others). Jie Kou Biao Yao (Yu Zuogou is dedicated to serving his master).
dog
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[â‘ ]ï¼»quÇnï¼½
["Guangyun" bitter cutting, milling, creek. ]
(1) The name of the livestock. Commonly known as a dog. It is one of the earliest domesticated domestic animals. Hearing and smell are sensitive. Vigilant and easy to train. There are many breeds, which can be divided into shepherd dogs, hunting dogs, police dogs, playing dogs, wanye dogs, and fur dogs according to their purpose.
(2) In the past, it was often used as a word of self-humility or contempt for others. See "dogs", "dogs and horses".

There's a good chance you know the word for dog in Japanese already too. If so, you're ahead of the game. If not, do your best to learn the reading before moving on.
